@Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice are 1d6s that can be spent on various Cleric abilities.  
    You can retain up to 2 @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice by default.  That maximum increases for every odd-numbered Cleric level gained starting at Cleric level 3.  For example, at Cleric level 8, you can hold a maximum of 5 @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice.  
    If you gain a @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Die while at your maximum, roll the @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Die and gain temporary hit points equal to the result.  If you lose a @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Die while out of @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice, unless stated otherwise, your @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice goes into the negative.  There is no negative cap to @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice.  While you have negative amounts of @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice, you cannot use abilities that cost @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice, and you have Disadvantage on Wisdom (Save) and Wisdom (Theology) checks.  
    You cannot trigger your Eikonic Number, a Natural 1, or a Natural 20 via the spending of your @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.65D4NMYRBMKHW59K]{🕯 Faith} Dice.
